title: Permabanned
body: I've had my account for 6 seasons and I've spent almost 3,000$ on the game. I recently got permabanned for 5 reports in my last 20 games. How can I be heavily reported in 3 games with only 5 reports? I have no idea. I don't know if Riot actually plays their game, but 5 reports in 20 sounds pretty tame. I play jungle, and generally when you start losing everyone looks to the jungler as to why they are losing. That's just generally how it works because lanes expect the jungle to win their lane especially in lower elo's where the just don't understand how the game works. Also, you ever disagree with a person and turns out they're duo? Yeah that's 2 reports right there. I don't know exactly how to reform the banning system, however, I do feel permanent suspension is way too common. I usually play competitive league (as in 5v5 teams formed prior and play in tourneys) and pretty much everyone in that scene has at least one perma banned account. The reasoning is simple, these are people that want to win first and foremost and that makes their dialogue a little rough around the edges. I don't think toxicity should ever lead to perma ban when muting is a feature in the game, toxic gameplay is much more annoying to every single person in the community. Mainly, I'd like some of my money back just to know Riot isn't trying to take it and run with it. I even still had like 3,000 rp on it that I never got to spend. What do you guys think? Is permaban too prevalent? Is Riot falling deeper into the white knight propaganda similar to Overwatch? Or am I just a drama queen? Let me know.

replies.body: Logs or didn't happen

Have you sent a message to the player support team? I'd imagine they'd at least give you a bit more info about why you were banned. I'm not 100% certain about what all goes into a ban, but I do know that there are some very specific things that, if verified (and yes we do verify before banning), will expedite that process. For example racial slurs, death threats, etc.

I did I told them to highlight where I went against TOS or Summoner's code or whatever and they did not they just said "I know its frustrating dealing with teammates acting aggressive towards you" the thing is I don't care about that. I never report for toxicity because I can just mute. I know it's an amazing feature never used by the people who really need it

I understand where you're coming from, but Mute is just there so players can stop further issues (usually after someone has already become a problem) so they can focus on the game. It doesn't stop the person from continuing to be a problem for others, and it's on that player to fix their behavior, not on everyone else to avoid them.

Imagine if a kid sat in his house pointing a laser beam in driver's eyes as they pass by; is it the driver's responsibility to wear sunglasses to stop it, or is that kid responsible for his behavior and needs to be stopped and held accountable? Of course the answer is that the kid is at fault. Drivers who have never passed by the house before can't be expected to wear sunglasses, nor should the drivers who know be forced to impede their vision on account of someone else's abusive behavior.

Kids who play with lasers is why we report people, but also keep sunglasses handy just in case we need to mute them :3 (yes I know that is not *actually* a logical sentence)
it wasn't a logical sentence or metaphor not trying to be mean it just made no sense playing league isnt gonna make you land in a ditch on the side of I-55

The meaning is that disruptive or abusive behavior is not ok just because others can mute it. Each individual is responsible for their own behavior, and reporting is there to help prevent this behavior in the future for everyone else that play with them, while muting is there as a temporary and immediate reprieve for a single game (even though it gets in the way of useful communicating too).

There is no useful communication in this game everything useful can be communicated through pings and the braindead sheeple you have playing it don't mentally check in enough to see what you see this game is dying because you rely on leftist ideals to keep your playerbase on the high moral horse and shove out players that actually know the game and are good at it and are reasonably frustrated by the incompetence that surrounds them on a daily basis.
Please tell me how you would communicate "let's send Annie and Vayne bot to pull them away then we take Baron in couple mins" with pings?
they would respond with "who made you shotcaller" or just not respond and run it down mid. Do you actually play this game or you just stay on boards all day? I think the answer it clear

Either we are playing different games or you are saying things in a very different way that causes people to respond with hostility.

I find that my teams are more than willing to communicate and coordinate. But if you’re a jerk like you’ve been to everyone in this thread, I can see why nobody would want to work with you.
i mean i know this is a realtively old post but your last game was in 2017? either thats a bug or sumshit or you really dont play the game. (not flaming just feel that if its a bug you should know)

Nope, 9 times out of 10, I say something as simple as "hey try to cs for a bit and get even, since you're behind now" and they just hard int. You are the one playing a very different game, I would imagine lol

there is a difference between "hey, try to cs because you are behind" and "hang in there bot lane, help is coming, just hold out for a little longer" 

One is giving advice, and one is sympathetic. be more sympathetic in your wording and people will respond with less hostility.
its ok tho just keep making female characters with their knockers hanging out and the white knight anime jerk offs will continue to pour in

Akali does have a ton of sex appeal.... but shes SUPPOSED to. Female assassins used sex appeal to kill their targets.

The point is that the existence of a tool t hat mitigates a problem isn't an excuse to be causing that problem.

> [{quoted}](name=WHO U TESTIN,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=Mvfz67ph,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2019-04-21T19:29:47.196+0000)

> I did I told them to highlight where I went against TOS or Summoner's code or whatever and they did not they just said "I know its frustrating dealing with teammates acting aggressive towards you" the thing is I don't care about that. I never report for toxicity because I can just mute. I know it's an amazing feature never used by the people who really need it

Here's the problem: YOUR policy is “never report toxicity, mute only” but that's not Riot's policy, and it's not a secret policy either.

The question isn't “would I be banned by my standards?” because the answer to that question is normally “no”.  It's whether you broke the standards Riot put forth, and it seems obvious that you did.

EVERYONE gets heated from time to time; most people who have a bad game don't get banned, or even chat restricted, to get that you have to show a habit of unsportsmanlike behavior, and I'm sorry if you don't think the game should require you to be a good sport, but people shouldn't be forced to mute you to play with you, that's some pretty hardcore victim blaming right there.  No one was forcing you to use the chat function.

IDK, did you ever try to write a message to the support?

90%+ of the time they are just mindless bots, and ye, sometimes they are nice and useful. Maybe OP was not lucky enough.

That's really easy to say but it's who I am as a person I am direct and I don't tolerate bullshit which is omnipresent in this game. Making the rules clear for 48 million players is actually easier than changing who I am as a person

DING DING DING DING!  Check out the big brain over here!

> [{quoted}](name=WHO U TESTIN,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=Mvfz67ph,comment-id=000400000000000000000001000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-04-21T20:02:50.517+0000)
>
> racial slurs, death threats specific things like that. Not overly specific but there is some sort of guideline

Should they have to tell you that you shouldnt do that? Seems like common human decency to me.

Who you are as a person and having the responsibility and maturity to control your actions and behavior are two entirely different things. Being direct and not tolerating bullshit is fine, but you're actively seeking out to flame and berate other players. You have a lot of self-analyzing to do, because who you think you are, and reading those chat logs, it's just a huge yikes.

Learn to control yourself and what you say. You got banned because people got tired of putting up with *your* bullshit.

Whether it's 48 million people or 1 person, no one should have to tolerate being the victim of toxic behavior. 

I am very on board with direct communication. I've been playing since like season 2, and I will write stuff like "Don't go down there any more, just stay in your lane". Very direct, no fluff, just giving an instruction. And while many people will flame in response to this type of communication, it is not toxic and has no ill intention whatsoever.

I don't think anyone would try to argue that that type of speech needs to be banned. But when you start throwing in the extra stuff...the insults, the backhanded comments, sarcasm, there is literally no point to it. There is nothing that can accomplish that you couldn't through straightforward communication. The only reason to do something like that would be to get some sort of sick satisfaction out of making another player angry. A degenerate type of mindset. Be a part of the solution, not the problem. 

Now, as someone who has been intentionally trolled many times in promo series, I can definitely agree with you that being trolled is often way more frustrating than being flamed. Having said that, flaming others does not solve anything. You cannot control other people. You can only control your behavior. Sure, you can't help how you feel. I don't want to get mad over a dumb video game, but you know what, I do. BUT...I get to choose how I handle that anger. We all have a choice.

Choose to be a part of the community that want to see, don't choose to be a problem in the community that is. Sure, maybe smurfs, inters, and trolls are more common than toxic behavior (I highly doubt that is the case but I can't argue with it because I haven't done the research)...even if that is the case that doesn't actually make toxicity less of an issue. Doesn't make you less of a dick.

No one likes toxicity the fact you think it is okay is a huge reason this community is unforgivably toxic especially to new players, just take your head out of your ass and realize what you were doing. Stop being a problem and learn to be chill and actually enjoy the damn game without being a dick.

I don't think rito would ban you for bs. 5 reports seems like a lot. Tbh don't know you but I think that there is a reason why you got banned. I honestly do think that rito knows what they are doing. And god bless them if there is one less toxic player. There is no reason to be toxic, even when teased. Your mental is either fit for the game or not, if not then you don't deserve the walk the rift no matter the amount of money you spent on virtual products.

There is a reason you have been reported maybe instead of yelling at the people who banned look at your words and fix your attitude towards other people.
